sentence.Network_en: I hunted with a musket two years ago.
sentence.Network_cn: 两年前我用滑膛枪打猎。

sentence.Network_en: Not a bough waved, not the gleam of a musket - barrel betrayed the presence of our foes.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有一根树枝摆动, 也没有一支火枪在太阳照射下闪光,所以我们无法知道敌人的位置.

sentence.Network_en: So some seconds passed, till suddenly Joyce whipped up his musket and fired.
sentence.Network_cn: 又过了几秒钟,突然, 乔伊斯端起枪来开了火.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French mousquet, from Italian moschetto 'crossbow bolt', from mosca 'a fly'

entry.def: A musket was an early type of gun with a long barrel, which was used before rifles were invented.

means.word_mean: 1. a muzzle-loading shoulder gun with a long barrel; formerly used by infantrymen
